text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bahraini press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Bahrain Petroleum Company to shut down two crude oil production units later this month for maintenance.
- President of the British Board of Trade visits Bahrain for talks to boost trade links.
- Foreign Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Mubarak al-Khalifa gets message from his Egyptian counterpart on the Middle East peace process.
- Emir, U.S. ambassador to Bahrain review latest regional developments. U.S. forces fired missiles against targets in Iraq on Tuesday and Wednesday.
- U.S. Defence Secretary Perry telephones Bahrain's Crown prince to discuss Gulf situation.
- Jordanian Prime Minister Kabariti affirms his country's desire to boost relations with Bahrain.
